channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken and dangerous road surface, 28th August
item.description:
The road surface is badly broken up and is a real danger to cyclists particularly those coming down Leckhampton Hill. The worse area is from the Old Bath Road to the Charlton Lane junctions. The surface requires immediate work to bring it up to an acceptable and safe standard. It is currently a serious hazard yo both cyclists and motorists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 188 Leckhampton Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 street signs badly damaged, 28th August
item.description:
Randolph Close and Marlborough Close , both signs need to be replaced , badly damaged almost illegible
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 5 Randolph Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, 28th August
item.description:
POTHOLES HAVE BEEN THERE FOR ALONG TIME , AND AR GETTING DEEPER , YOU HAVE TO ALTER DIRECTION TO ENTER THROUGH THE GATES CAUSED BY NUMEROUS CARS EXITING st EDWARDS SCHOOL DAILY AND TURNING TO EXIT TI THE MAIN ROAD

item.title: Mattress dumped, 27th August
item.description:

item.title: Multiple large potholes (10cm deep, 20-30cm across) - getting worse, 27th August
item.description:
Potholes are increasing in number and severity. Increasingly dangerous and hard to avoid for cyclists turning right from Shurdington Rd into Moorend Park Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Waterford Court Moorend Park Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Manhole cover protruding in road, 25th August
item.description:

item.description:

item.title: No street lights, 23rd August
